document_title: Purulent otitis media: Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Common symptoms of purulent otitis media are as follows:
1. Symptoms of acute purulent otitis media
Earache, with rapid onset from mild to severe discomfort, is the most common presenting symptom;
Hearing loss when there is middle ear fluid;; Ear discharge when the eardrum has been punctured;; Systemic symptoms such as fever, listlessness, malaise, anorexia, vomiting, and diarrhea are common. Patients may experience dizziness, facial swelling, nystagmus, tinnitus, lethargy, and facial nerve paralysis. These symptoms are also complications of severe acute otitis media.
2. Symptoms of chronic purulent otitis media
Hearing loss and ear discharge when causing a perforated eardrum;; Pain is an uncommon symptom, unless osteoarthritis involving the temporal bone occurs;; Ear discharge, painless, ear pus sometimes has a foul smell if the infection is caused by gram-negative bacilli or Staphylococcus aureus causing atrial perforation.
